stimulusHtml: A parallel-plate capacitor is connected to a power supply with potential difference Î”V. The area of the plates of the capacitor is doubled while the potential difference of the power supply is halved. A student claims that the charge stored on the capacitor must have increased. Is the claim correct? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because the electric potential decreased.
No, because the distance between the plates remains the same.
No, because the capacitance and electric potential difference both changed.
